pullrequest.title: Updated gzlog command line tool to filter state log files

content.raw:
This means you can't do hz filtering without specifying a filter string. For example, if you want all the data at a reduced rate, the following will not work:
~~~
gzlog echo -z 10 file
~~~

You have to instead use the following:
~~~
gzlog echo -z 10 --filter '*' file
~~~

Also, the following don't currently work either: `--filter *` (bash replaces * with all files in pwd), `--filter '.*'` (the dot is identified as a separator, rather than its usual regex meaning for any character).
content.html:
This means you can't do hz filtering without specifying a filter string. For example, if you want all the data at a reduced rate, the following will not work:

gzlog echo -z 10 file

You have to instead use the following:

gzlog echo -z 10 --filter '*' file

Also, the following don't currently work either: --filter * (bash replaces * with all files in pwd), --filter '.*' (the dot is identified as a separator, rather than its usual regex meaning for any character).
